comments.author: xCryptoManiaX
comments.body: I doubt that big games will implement NFTs anytime soon. Too much fraud around those. Even Steam with their CS:GO marketplace is having a hard time of stopping fraud. For example check this article: https://www.zdnet.com/article/valve-says-that-nearly-all-csgo-key-resales-are-being-used-to-launder-money/Now lets give an example. Even if Steam does make NFTs, they would still want to sell them on a centralized marketplace (the Steam marketplace) so they can control the items and any fraud. Turning them into NFTs would only add another layer of complexity and it is pretty pointless to do that. You can still sell your skins for real money, why would they add NFTs to the mix?If any other developer is going to add tradeable items to their game, I do believe that they will go with the same option - centralized marketplace. This is the only way they can have control over the items. Turning them into NFTs? I don't see a reason to do that.
